moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6: a normal starting to the game.
moves.3. Bb5 d6: I played d6 with a hope of less dangerous game.
moves.7. Bxf6 Bxf6: I think he exchanged his bishop for my knight because of my pawns in black squares to make the action ability of bishop fewer.
moves.8. O-O O-O 9. Nd5 Nd4: I tried to make kingside weaker by using the pinned knight of white.
moves.10. Nxf6+ Qxf6 11. Bd7 Nxf3+ 12. Kh1: I didnt understand why he didn't capture my bishop with his awn,although it makes king's defence weak, i didnt see any attack goes to mate.
moves.12... Nxh2: I didnt see double attack on bishop,however i got their castle for my bishop and knight.
moves.13. Bxg4 Qh4 14. Bh3 Nxf1 15. Qxf1 f5 16: And here i made a terrible mistake.To avoid attack of the rook on g file, i lost my queen.
moves.23. g5+ Qxg5 24. Rxg5 Kxg5: Given away my queen for rook.
moves.25. d4 exd4: Why did he give this pawn? I didnt understand.maybe for f4  that he didnt play.
moves.26. Qg3+ Kh6 27. f4 Kg7 28. fxg6 Rxg6: It says the pieces are equal.
moves.29. Bg4 h5: and here he makes a mistake and loses his bishop.
moves.30. f5 Rxg4 31. f6+ Rxf6 32. Qh3 Rfg6 33: 33...Rg1  34.Kh2 R6h2  35.Kh3 Rh1  36.Kxh2 Rxh5 would be more esthetical.
moves.34. Qxh6+ Kxh6 35. Kh2 Kh5 36. Kh3 c5 37: it is not so difficult to mate with an extra castle and two extra pawns so my oppent resigns here.
